title: Why that relevant to me ?: Ange Postecoglou explodes into fiery Man United rant after Europa League final reveal - Man United News And Transfer News
body_text:
Ange Postecoglou snapped at a reporter who brought up a Manchester United-related question during the post-match press conference following Tottenham Hotspurâ€™s 2-0 victory over Bodo/Glimt (5-1 on aggregate).
Like United, Tottenham have struggled domestically, but both sides now have the chance to qualify for the Champions League when they meet in the Europa League final later this month.
United booked their spot in the final after beating Athletic Club 4-1 on Thursday and 7-1 on aggregate.
In the presser, Matt Law of The Telegraph asked Postecoglou, â€œManchester United have constantly said this competition wonâ€™t save their season â€“ managers have said it, players have said it.â€
â€œWould it save Tottenhamâ€™s season, is it different for Tottenham?â€
An exasperated Postecoglou fired back, â€œI donâ€™t care â€“ why do I care what Man United think? Why is that relevant to me?â€
â€œAsk the Man United manager why he says that. Me, Iâ€™ve said all along that this is important.â€
The Australian coach was then asked, â€œWhat does it mean for Tottenhamâ€™s season then?â€
He answered, â€œYou probably know better than me and probably followed this club longer than I have. What do you think a trophy would do for this club?â€
The reporter replied, â€œMassive.â€
Postecoglou continued, â€œExactly right, so the question answers itself. But whatâ€™s happening right now is that people are fearing that, that it actually might happen.â€
â€œBecause it might happen theyâ€™re thinking, â€˜Letâ€™s see how we can tear it down somehow, diminish it somehow by saying itâ€™s been a poor season, we donâ€™t deserve this, we donâ€™t deserve thatâ€™, or somehow comparing us to Man United.â€
